text: A wolf was passing by a barley field, but since it was not food of his taste, he left it and went on his way. He found a horse and took him to the country, telling him how much barley he had found, but that instead of eating it himself, he had better leave it because he liked to hear the sound of his teeth more when chewing it. And the horse said to him, My friend, if the wolves eat barley, thou wouldest have preferred to eat it not in thy ears, but in thy stomach. Never believe an evil person, even if he seems to act like a good person.
title: El lobo y el caballo
author: nan Esopo
